conclusion: Understand the Velocity-Time Graph: The graph shows how the skydiver's velocity changes over time.
Identify the Interval: Focus on the interval from 0 to 10 seconds.
Analyze the Slope: The slope of the velocity-time graph represents acceleration. A positive slope indicates positive acceleration, and a negative slope indicates negative acceleration.
Observe the Slope (0 to 10 Seconds): At the beginning (0 seconds), the velocity starts at 0 m/s. From 0 to 10 seconds, the velocity increases until it reaches a peak.
Tangent Line: The red tangent line on the graph represents the rate of change of velocity at that point. During 0 to 10 seconds, this slope is positive.
Conclusion: Since the slope is positive, the velocity is increasing, which means the acceleration is positive.
Direction of Acceleration: Positive acceleration during this interval indicates that the acceleration is in the same direction as the velocity, which is downward.
